summary: Gypsum is a common mineral made of calcium sulfate. It is soft and often used in fertilizers and to make plaster and drywall. You might also see it as the chalk used on blackboards. Gypsum can form beautiful, translucent crystals called selenite. It is usually white or lightly colored, and artists have used it for sculptures for thousands of years. Ancient civilizations like Egypt, Rome, and Mesopotamia loved using gypsum for their art.
title: Gypsum
